Lecturer/Researcher, Statistics Wollo University, Dessie, Ethiopia September 2016 – Present

Training (Preparing and delivering statistical software), workshops, and seminars
Teaching and Learning
Advising and supervising
Participating in research and community service activities
Research Coordinator in the Department of Statistics at Wollo University

Lecturer, Statistics Aksum University, Axum, Ethiopia February 2013 - August 2016



MSc in Statistics Thesis title: “Forecasting of petroleum oil import prices by GARCH models: The case of Ethiopia” School of Graduate Studies, Department of Statistics, Addis Ababa University, Addis Ababa, Ethiopia September 2010 – January 2013
BSc in Statistics Department of Statistics, University of Gondar, Gondar, Ethiopia Sep 2006 to July 2008

Gebeye LG, Dessie EY and Yimam JA (2024). Predictors of micronutrient deficiency among children aged 6–23 months in Ethiopia: a machine learning approach. Front. Nutr. 10:1277048. doi: 10.3389/fnut.2023.1277048. Link to publication





May 31 - June 01, 2024 - Delivered a Data Carpentry Workshop training using spreadsheet, OpenRefine, and R software at Wollo University, Dessie, Ethiopia.
April 23, 2024: Certified Instructor, The Carpentries - Teaches foundational data science and computational skills to researchers worldwide.
May 15 – 19, 2023: Big data analytics for agribusiness and environment using Python from EUDIF project
May 06 – 13, 2023: Casual inference from observational data using R, Ethiopian Statistical Association
March 27 – Apr 01, 2023: Digital Data Visualization using Power BI, Ethiopian Statistical Association
March 21 – 25, 2023: Digital Data Collection using Kobo Toolbox, Ethiopian Statistical Association
March 16 – 22, 2023: Introduction to python programming from EUDIF project
July 28 – Nov 2, 2022: Supervised Machine Learning: Regression and Classification from DeepLearning.AI & Stanford University on Coursera. View certificate
Oct 27, 2019 – July 20, 2022: Data Science Specialization from Johns Hopkins University on Coursera. Certificate earned on July 20, 2022. View certificate
June 7, 2020 – July 20, 2022: Data Science: Statistics and Machine Learning Specialization from Johns Hopkins University on Coursera. Certificate earned on July 20, 2022. View certificate
March 30 – April 5, 2021: Trainer for “Data Management and Statistical Analysis using R and SPSS”. Provided community service training to High School and Agriculture College teachers in Haik and Kombolcha town, organized by the Research and Publication Directorate office. Covered the fundamentals of data management and statistical analysis using R and SPSS.
June 2, 2021: Practical Machine Learning from Johns Hopkins University on Coursera. View certificate
July 26, 2020: Applied Machine Learning in Python from University of Michigan on Coursera. View certificate
June 21, 2020: Python for Data Science, AI & Development from IBM on Coursera. View certificate
May 16, 2020: Applied Plotting, Charting & Data Representation in Python from University of Michigan on Coursera. View certificate
April 22, 2020: Data Science: Foundations using R from Johns Hopkins University on Coursera. View certificate
December 6, 2019: R Programming from Johns Hopkins University on Coursera. View certificate
October 26, 2019: Introduction to Data Science in Python from University of Michigan on Coursera. View certificate
September 3 – 6, 2019: Trainer for “Introduction to R and RStudio Basics”. Conducted training sessions for academic staff members of the School of Veterinary Medicine at Wollo University, organized by the Research and Publication Directorate office. Covered the fundamentals of R programming language and RStudio software.
August 13 – 16, 2019: Trainer for “Introduction to R and RStudio Basics”. Delivered training to academic staff members of the college of Agriculture at Wollo University, organized by the Research and Publication Directorate office. Covered the fundamentals of R programming language and RStudio software.
September 3 – 7, 2018: Data analysis and software skill training on data organization in spread sheet, data cleaning in OpenRefine, data analysis and visualization in R and RStudio run by data and software carpentry.
November 25 – December 06, 2017: Trainer for “R statistical computing software for academic staffs of College of Medicine & Health Sciences”. Conducted training sessions for the staff of the College of Medicine and Health Science at Wollo University. The training was organized by the College of Medicine and Health Science in collaboration with Amhara Regional Health Bureau and CDC from November 25, 2017 – December 06, 2017 at Wollo University. The training covered the fundamentals of the R programming language with applications in health science and medicine.
September, 2013 – June, 2014: The Higher Diploma For Teacher Educator





Mother tongue(s): Amharic
Other language(s): English (C2-Proficient user)
Communication skills: Good communication skills developed through experience as a lecturer.
Job-related skills: Good problem-solving skill developed by interaction with colleagues and students in institution
Computer skills:

Presentation: Microsoft PowerPoint
Spread sheet: Microsoft Excel
Word Processing: Microsoft Word






SPSS, ODK, Kobo Toolbox, Power BI, STATA, SAS, R, Python, EViews
Technical skills and ability

Proficient in statistical software including SPSS, ODK, Kobo Toolbox, Power BI, STATA, SAS, R, Python, and EViews.
Strong mathematical and statistical skills to gather, measure, organize, analyze, and interpret data.
Experience with data collection pipelines based on the Open Data Kit (ODK) or Kobo Toolbox.
Use R for data cleaning, analysis, and visualization.
Utilize Python for data manipulation, visualization, and machine learning, including spatial analysis.
Manage data science projects using GitHub.
Develop public data products.
Perform machine learning methods and algorithms, such as regression and classification using R and Python.
Build machine learning models in R and Python.
Conduct regression analysis, least squares, and inference using regression models.
Manage large datasets, create visualizations, and publish reproducible analyses.
Proficient in creating relevant data sets, tables, figures, and analytical analysis.
Experience in geographic data visualizations like static maps, interactive web maps, and dashboards using Leaflet, Shiny, and GoogleVis.
Provide statistical software training in SPSS, R, and STATA on various topics.






Memberships: Ethiopian Statistical Association (ESA)

title: Teaching
text:
Statistical computing I
Statistical computing II
Regression Analysis
Econometrics
Time series analysis
Probability Theory
Statistical Inference

title: Leykun Getaneh Gebeye
text:
Leykun Getaneh Gebeye is a senior lecturer, data scientist, and statistician with expertise in machine learning, time series analysis, and big data analysis. He holds a BSc and a MSc in Statistics, and is certified a data science specialization from John Hopkins University through Coursera. With over 7 years of experience as a lecturer at Wollo University in Ethiopia, Leykun has extensive experience in teaching, advising, and conducting research. He actively contributes to training programs and workshops related to statistical software and is proficient in a wide range of statistical software and programming languages, including R and Python. This proficiency enables him to effectively collect, clean, analyze, and visualize data.
His research interests include:

machine learning,
big data analysis,

disease prediction,

longitudinal data analysis,

survival analysis, deep learning on survival analysis,

joint modeling, and

nutrition.



Addis Ababa University | Addis Ababa, Ethiopia
MSc in Statistics | Sept 2010 - Jan 2013

BSc in Statistics | Sept 2006 - July 2008
